title: Ticket #7085: Add uploads to Box multifile transfer plugin
description: Multifile transfer plugins can also accept a "-upload" argument to signal that files should be uploaded. We can and should support this for the Box transfer plugin.
remarks:
2019-Jul-08 16:36:11 by jpatton:
[57348] added upload capability, though there is a bug/oversight currently in the filetransfer plugin framework where certain transfer statistics are required for uploads (e.g. TransferUrl) while they are optional for downloads. It doesn't make much sense to include the TransferUrl for plugins of this type, it's always going to be something like https://upload.box.com/api/2.0/files/21487435/content, and I'm not sure it's great to be leaving file id numbers (the 21487435 part of the URL above) around on disk.

As is, uploading using the box plugin gives the following hold message, even though the upload completes successfully. I have verified that jamming in a bogus TransferUrl into the output classad prevents the hold message/leads to successful completion (in HTCondor's eyes): 

Error from slot2@localhost: STARTER at xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx failed to send file(s) to <xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx:9618>: :
FILETRANSFER:1:Multi-file plugin at /opt/file_transfer_plugins/box_plugin.py did not produce valid response;
missing TransferUrl; SHADOW failed to receive file(s) from <xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx:1955>

2019-Jul-10 10:27:14 by jpatton:
For now I'm using a generic TransferUrl (the upload endpoint without the file id) to avoid jobs going on hold.
